body.para: The debugger inside Visual Studio is language agnostic. We have added support for our X# language, so you will see variables in the locals and autos windows with X# specific types and so you can enter expressions for breakpoint conditions, in the watch window and in the intermediate window in X# (case insensitive for example).
There is an options page from where you can control how the X# debugger Expression evaluator parses and compiles expressions.
Most options that you see on the screen are identical to compiler options that we have.
By default the debugger expression evaluator allows "late binding". If this causes negative side effects then you can disable that option in this dialog.
